reviews.text: Stayed here on a stopover on the drive from San Francisco to Vancouver. Rooms was large and clean but the decor was a little dated. Staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice Staff, Good Location, Rooms a little dated

reviews.text: I stayed here for three days in mid April along with some friends and relatives for a local wedding. We had a downstairs room, #102, with a sliding glass door that opened up to a long stretch of well-manicured lawn that ran alongside an attractive creek. The rooms along this area are #101 through I believe #117 and are perfect for dogs. It gave them a pleasant place for them to run, socialize with other dogs and do their thing. There were several dog cleanup stations along the fenced in area and I found the area to be very clean the entire time we were there even though we did see a handful of other dogs each day. There are also chairs and chaise lounges on the individual patios to sit on and some nice sturdy picnic tables out on the lush lawns to gather with friends and to watch your dog play. The rooms were extremely clean and quiet. Although the freeway is close and in view from the lawn area along the creek, the freeway sound was never an issue and did not disturb any of our conversations while we were outside.
reviews.title: Best Dog Friendly place to stay, Clean and very relaxing stay.

reviews.text: The rooms are very quiet for sleeping and I never heard the people upstairs or next-door at anytime during our stay. The beds and bedding were very comfortable. I did not come across any bugs at all as referred to in other reviews. The room was large and had two queen beds and plenty of drawers and storage space for everything we brought with us. Closet for hanging items was small but adequate for our stay. Very nice shower and bathroom. Room had vanity sink inside bathroom and also a vanity and sink just outside of bathroom so could use even if other guest in room was using bathroom.
reviews.title: Very large, clean rooms. Will be staying here again!

reviews.text: Complimentary Continental Breakfast located off Lobby was very nice, clean and well stocked. There are three restaurants within a 100 yards walk if you want a hot breakfast (Denny's, The Purple Plum and Grandma's). Breakfast Room overlooks creek on one side and swimming pool on the other.
reviews.title: Give it a try

reviews.text: We walked up and down the streets of the old town area beginning just a block from the motel. Lot's of history and dog friendly quaint shops. Grandma's Restaurant is very close by for a decent, low cost meal anytime throughout the day. We brought goodies back to the room to enjoy out on the picnic tables.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first glance this seemed like a good location. The front desk gave us good maps of the area and Yreka was an interesting small town.
reviews.title: Nice place until the bugs got me

reviews.text: Then during the night the bed bugs hit. We cannot recommend this property to anyone.
reviews.title: Not Just Like Home but Very Nice

reviews.text: The hotel denies that they have a problem - the bites on my shoulder, back and hands have a different story to tell.
reviews.title: BEDBUGS!!! Yikes!

reviews.text: When I travel between Washington and California I generally am alone. I make it a point to stay in Yreka and always stay at the Best Western Miners Inn. On the last trip I was heading north to Washington. I called ahead and there was no problem making the reservations. When I got there the lady at the front desk made me feel right at home, got me checked in quickly and let me know about a few special offerings from the chain. The room was clean, quiet and very comfortable. I checked out the next morning after breakfast and got the same treatment. I would not even look for another place to stay when I pass through Yreka. As far as food goes I'm sure it fine but if anyone has ever been to Yreka they know the place to go is Grandma's....which is another reason for staying at BWMI.....right next door (well, except for the gas station). For as long as I'm making this trip Best Western always has my business. Yreka is always a planned stop and they are part of the reason.
reviews.title: not happy children

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 weeks while working in Yreka. I started noticing itchy bumps all over my body that kept getting worse and worse. I investigated some more and found I was being feasted on by BEDBUGS!!! How horrifying. Do NOT stay here, under ANY circumstances!
reviews.title: Decent night's stay

reviews.text: This hotel is on the larger side of most small town hotels. It was close to Old Downtown Yreka and some restaurants. There aren't that many big hotels in the area so I guess we should be happy that we didn't end up in some flea bag motel. The room itself was roomy and clean. The showers were horrible, they totally need to invest in some arcing shower curtain rods and better shower heads. We had a small fridge but no microwave. The breakfast was nice and there was plenty of seating. If I had to come to Yreka again, I think I would most likely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: OK, not great.

reviews.text: wesome Hotel. We stayed there for a night on our way to disneyland. The room was extremely clean and smelled great. The continental breakfast had great variety. We enjoyed our stay so much we stopped there on the way home again. The room was again great!!! Huge room with all the things that are need for a hotel stay (fridge, microwave, etc). Even nicer than the first room we stayed. Dont hesitate to stay here! You won't be disappointed. Can't wait to stay there again. Thanks Miner's Inn!!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in the Area!!! A+++++++

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was good sized and the bed was comfortable. When we entered the room there was a residual scent, possible cleaning chemicals. After a short airing out the smell was gone. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Complimentary breakfast was mediocre. Price was right. A step above from Motel 6 but definitely not the Ritz.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: This Best Western definitely exceeded our expectations. The room/decor had clearly been updated and was much more contemporary. Check-in was a quick process and we were in our room within 5 minutes of arriving. The rooms are clean, quiet and the beds were very comfortable. The continental breakfast had a good variety of food - I appreciated that there were several types of fresh fruit. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would absolutely stay here again ..... and would refer any family and friends to this location.
reviews.title: Very Pleased With Our Stay Here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read some of the negative reviews and can honestly say that we didn't experience any poor service. Definitely give this hotel a try and come to your own conclusion. You'll be pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Clean-convienient-reasonable price

reviews.text: Stayed here in July. Much cheaper than the BW in Shasta just a little ways' down the road. Creekside rooms have a little nicer view than the other rooms that look out on parking lot. Large room, clean and neat.
reviews.title: Go somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Miserable welcome from an unhappy receptionist. Given a poor room as I had booked through an agency ( but did get changed). All questions regarding pool use and local dining were begrudgingly answered. Rooms were dark and dull. Very noisy AC.
reviews.title: it's a dump!
